there's actually like five pegs that fit

quite beefy I haven't really checked it

hold it like on the 7 by 10 lathe is

grizzly shipped the lathe very quickly
within just a day or two of me ordering
it and FedEx normally would have only

separately from the lathe itself and I
was worried about how that was gonna
work out but actually it was easier than
I thought I just used this standard
winch or come along and supported it by
a few of the joists the ceiling joists
and was able to just winch the lathe up
pretty easily and set it back down onto
the stands the stands are pretty low
quality castings there's a lot of you
know rough surface and the paint job
isn't so good but they're very sturdy
there's a lot of metal there and so the
lathe is quite securely mounted to them
the lathe has kind of an unusual
electrical system it has this emergency
lockout which you turn to
get the power on and then it also has an

another closes another relay in there
and then it and the lay it has a forward
and reversing switch on the carriage
which is actually pretty nice so down to
go forward I don't have to go in Reverse
and then when you're done using the
lathe for the day the only way to make
it go off is to press the emergency
reset and that shuts off the whole
system the levers all move pretty
smoothly I'm pretty happy with how how
easily it is how easy it is to move all
these levers the only one that doesn't
move all that well is the selector that
changes between the lead screw and the
drive screw or the drive shaft that
powers the power cross feed so this
one's a little stiff but you know I
hardly ever shift that one and the gear
changes down here you know reasonably
good maybe not as good as they could be
but they work the only modification I've
made to the lathe is to add LED lighting
to the to the work light here this was
originally a 24 volt halogen light and
it was it was bright alright but but
very yellow and very hot I mean if the
light is close in and you're putting

i did was i just i added a 12 volt power

thing and then ran the 12 volts up to
here and put a premade LED replacement

volt LED light and it's pretty nice i

the original I would say and it's
totally cool you can keep your hand here
without without melting it speaking of

there's also multiple interrupts errs
for the the motor control so that it has
like this this reset system and
addition to the forward reverse switch
on the carriage overall really well done
I'm actually kind of surprised at how
much care was put into it the hand
wheels all respond very well
I know that the backlash in a hand wheel
doesn't really indicate the machines
precision but it's still very nice just
from sort of an operator's standpoint so
if I turn this to zero there's really
only about four divisions of of play in
this one and on the compound you know
it's even less it's only about it's only
about one and a half divisions of free
play on the on the compound very nice
and the carriage only has about three
three divisions of play on this one so a
pretty nice responsive stuff and like
you say that the levers all work pretty
smoothly so far the only problem I've
had with this is that when it was
shipped to me the thread counter dial
didn't work because it had the wrong
number of teeth on the gear here so it
was shipped to me with a 15 tooth
on the thread counter dial and so I was
testing out thread chasing and it
couldn't figure out why it wasn't
working I was very careful to always
engage on the number and everything and
it wasn't working and so finally I took
the gear out and counted it and it had
15 teeth and the lead screw here is I
think eight threads per inch so I knew
that was wrong and I called up grizzly
and they said that the 15 tooth gear is
actually for metric lathes so it makes
sense they just got mixed up at the
factory and and put the metrically sized
gear on here so they sent me a 16 to 3
and now the thread chasing dial works
just fine the tailstock is also very
easy to use it's got a nice big lever

here I guess for really high

it was completely missing on the seven
